nodes.bodyText: Should this return UNKNOWN since there may be a type in a new version that the client doesn't know about?
Since this is a public API, we should include this change in the KIP.
We should also send a note to the VOTE thread on the mailing list to mention that the KIP was updated.
Can we switch over to using the generated DescribeConfigsRequestData class?
Same as the request, can we switch over to the generated class?
Unrelated to this PR, but since you are updating this file anyway, can you fix the typo in IncludeSynonyms?
ConfigType.UNKNOWN instead of null since we use that as the default elsewhere?
Why is ConfigValue Type ignorable, but Documentation not?
nodes.diffHunk:

           { "name": "Source", "type": "int8", "versions": "1+",
             "about": "The synonym source." }
-        ]}

+        { "name": "ConfigValueType", "type": "int8", "versions": "3+", "default": "0", "ignorable": true,
+          "about": "The configuration data type. Type can be one of the following values - BOOLEAN, STRING, INT, SHORT, LONG, DOUBLE, LIST, CLASS, PASSWORD" },
+        { "name": "Documentation", "type": "string", "versions": "3+", "nullableVersions": "0+",

nodes.bodyText: Documentation should be ignorable as well. I'll update the kip.

nodes.bodyText: case _ => UNKNOWN or throw an exception?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -658,6 +658,26 @@ class AdminManager(val config: KafkaConfig,
     DynamicBrokerConfig.brokerConfigSynonyms(name, matchListenerOverride = true)
   }
 
+  private def brokerDocumentation(name: String): String = {
+    config.documentationOf(name)
+  }
+
+  private def configResponseType(configType: Option[ConfigDef.Type]): DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType = {
+    if (configType.isEmpty)
+      DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.UNKNOWN
+    else configType.get match {
+      case ConfigDef.Type.BOOLEAN => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.BOOLEAN
+      case ConfigDef.Type.STRING => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.STRING
+      case ConfigDef.Type.INT => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.INT
+      case ConfigDef.Type.SHORT => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.SHORT
+      case ConfigDef.Type.LONG => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.LONG
+      case ConfigDef.Type.DOUBLE => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.DOUBLE
+      case ConfigDef.Type.LIST => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.LIST
+      case ConfigDef.Type.CLASS => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.CLASS
+      case ConfigDef.Type.PASSWORD => DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType.PASSWORD

nodes.bodyText: Return UNKNOWN to prevent older clients from breaking
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -658,6 +658,26 @@ class AdminManager(val config: KafkaConfig,
     DynamicBrokerConfig.brokerConfigSynonyms(name, matchListenerOverride = true)
   }
 
+  private def brokerDocumentation(name: String): String = {
+    config.documentationOf(name)
+  }
+
+  private def configResponseType(configType: Option[ConfigDef.Type]): DescribeConfigsResponse.ConfigType = {

nodes.bodyText: Any reason this is called ConfigValueType here while it is called ConfigType everywhere else?
No, I should have used ConfigType everywhere.
